titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Peter Cain, Indictment
CWG7259

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Washington Circuit Court
Peter Cain

The Grand Jury of Washington County in the name and by the authority of the commonwealth of Kentucky accuse of the crime of Burglary Commited as follows the Said Peter Cain on the 10th day of February 1865 in the county aforesaid in the night time broke and entered the dwelling house of Joseph Blanford with intent to commit a fellony against the peace and dignity of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses before the Jury
Joseph Blanford
L. H Noble atty for Comlth

Copy attest
J P Barbour clk

No 4
X
Commonwealth
Indict
Burgarylary
Peter Cain
a true bill
D McHenry
Foreman of the Grand Jury
$300
filed Oct 17th 1865
J P Barbour clk
